title: Sense (river)
text:
The river Sense (; ; , locally ) is a right tributary of the river <a href="Saane/Sarine">Saane</a> in <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>. It is a border river between the Cantons of <a href="Canton%20of%20Fribourg">Fribourg</a> and <a href="Canton%20of%20Bern">Bern</a>. Its source rivers, the "Kalte Sense", coming from Mount <a href="Gantrisch">Gantrisch</a>, and "Warme Sense", flowing out of lake <a href="Schwarzsee">Schwarzsee</a>, join at Zollhaus and thus form the origin of the Sense.
The Sense flows through a gorge of 15 km length, which is popular for <a href="whitewater">whitewater</a> sports, but also for swimming and bathing – especially among <a href="nudism">nudists</a>. Its main tributary is the river Schwarzwasser.
After about 35 km, the Sense joins the Saane river at <a href="Laupen">Laupen</a>. Because the Sense's water level can rise rapidly during hefty rainstorms, it is dangerous to stay near the river bed in uncertain weather conditions.
